Situation1: They share only one open evening before a busy travel week.
Expectation2: Communicate politely and professionally with customers
Situation2: The customer asks about the delivery status
Story: Tonight was supposed to be special. My girlfriend and I had circled this evening on our calendars weeks ago, knowing it was the only time we’d have together before I left for a week-long delivery route. She’d cooked my favorite meal, set the table, and even lit candles. I could see the excitement in her eyes as we sat down, both of us eager to make the most of these precious hours. Just as I reached for her hand, my phone buzzed. It was a customer, asking about a delayed package. As a delivery person, I’m expected to respond quickly and professionally, no matter the hour. I glanced at my girlfriend, her smile faltering as she noticed my attention shift. My mind raced—should I answer now and risk ruining our evening, or ignore the message and potentially upset a customer? The weight of both roles pressed on me, each demanding something I couldn’t give at the same time. I stared at my phone, torn, feeling the tension rise in the quiet room.
